result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John P Loiacano in court with attorney James Michael Dickinson.  Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant John P Loiacano in court with attorney James Michael Dickinson.  Andrew R. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Total bond cover all files 16CT29, 16CT85, and 16CM102.  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
